articles.headline: The Potential Dark Side of a White-Hot Labor Market
articles.snippet: The strong job market may be about to take a turn for the worse. That could come to haunt those who made choices based on today’s conditions.
articles.abstract: The strong job market may be about to take a turn for the worse. That could come to haunt those who made choices based on today’s conditions.
articles.lead_paragraph: Shanna Jackson, the president of Nashville State Community College, is struggling with a dilemma that reads like good news: Her students are taking jobs from employers who are eager to hire, and paying them good wages.

articles.headline: Proud Boys Charged With Sedition in Capitol Attack
articles.snippet: An amended federal indictment charged five members of the far-right group, including Enrique Tarrio, its former leader, with seditious conspiracy for their roles in the Jan. 6 assault.
articles.abstract: An amended federal indictment charged five members of the far-right group, including Enrique Tarrio, its former leader, with seditious conspiracy for their roles in the Jan. 6 assault.
articles.lead_paragraph: Enrique Tarrio, the former chairman of the Proud Boys, and four other members of the far-right group were indicted on Monday for seditious conspiracy for their roles in the storming of the Capitol on Jan. 6 of last year, some of the most serious criminal charges to be brought in the Justice Department’s sprawling investigation of the assault.
articles.byline: By Alan Feuer, Adam Goldman and Luke Broadwater

articles.headline: Boris Johnson survives no-confidence vote over lockdown parties, but is left reeling politically.
articles.snippet: More than 40 percent of lawmakers in Mr. Johnson’s own Conservative Party voted to remove him, a sign that he may struggle to remain prime minister.
articles.abstract: More than 40 percent of lawmakers in Mr. Johnson’s own Conservative Party voted to remove him, a sign that he may struggle to remain prime minister.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Prime Minister Boris Johnson survived a tense vote of no confidence on Monday, fending off a mutiny that nevertheless leaves him reeling and presages a volatile period in British politics, as he fights to stay in power and lead a divided Conservative Party.
articles.byline: By Mark Landler and Stephen Castle

articles.headline: Potent Weapons Reach Ukraine Faster Than the Know-How to Use Them
articles.snippet: Soldiers desperate for advanced arms to match their Russian enemies have resorted to Google Translate to decipher the instructions for their sophisticated new tools.
articles.abstract: Soldiers desperate for advanced arms to match their Russian enemies have resorted to Google Translate to decipher the instructions for their sophisticated new tools.
articles.lead_paragraph: KHERSON REGION, Ukraine — Since Russia invaded, NATO nations have upgraded Ukraine’s arsenal with increasingly sophisticated tools, with more promised, like the advanced multiple-launch rocket systems pledged by the United States and Britain.
articles.byline: By Thomas Gibbons-Neff and Natalia Yermak

articles.headline: Don’t Believe Everything You Read About the Man in This Photo
articles.snippet: A picture of Jordie Jordan, an online gamer, has been attached to a fake name and numerous bogus reports of his death, including from the mass shootings in Uvalde, Texas.
articles.abstract: A picture of Jordie Jordan, an online gamer, has been attached to a fake name and numerous bogus reports of his death, including from the mass shootings in Uvalde, Texas.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the outpouring of grief immediately after the recent school shooting in Uvalde, Texas, posts appeared on Twitter and other social media platforms about a man named “Bernie.” He was a teacher at Robb Elementary School who died sheltering his students from gunfire, the posts said. Many of the posts included a picture of a grinning, bearded man in glasses.

articles.headline: Yellen Defends Pandemic Spending as Inflation Persists
articles.snippet: The Treasury secretary’s recent comments about rising prices have put the Biden administration on the defensive.
articles.abstract: The Treasury secretary’s recent comments about rising prices have put the Biden administration on the defensive.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — At her confirmation hearing in early 2021, Treasury Secretary Janet L. Yellen told lawmakers that it was time to “act big” on a pandemic relief package, playing down concerns about deficits at a time of perpetually low interest rates and warning that inaction could mean widespread economic “scarring.”

articles.headline: Global Growth Will Be Choked Amid Inflation and War, World Bank Says
articles.snippet: “For many countries, recession will be hard to avoid,” David Malpass, head of the bank, said.
articles.abstract: “For many countries, recession will be hard to avoid,” David Malpass, head of the bank, said.
articles.lead_paragraph: For large and small nations around the globe, the prospect of averting a recession is fading.

articles.headline: Shell, the Oil Giant, Will Sell Renewable Energy to Texans
articles.snippet: The European oil company has been expanding into green energy even as many U.S. energy giants have kept their focus on fossil fuels.
articles.abstract: The European oil company has been expanding into green energy even as many U.S. energy giants have kept their focus on fossil fuels.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — Shell said on Tuesday that it would begin selling electricity generated from renewable sources to residents and businesses in Texas, a move that brings the European oil company’s shift to green energy to the U.S. market.
articles.byline: By Clifford Krauss and Ivan Penn

articles.headline: Fox News Doesn’t Plan to Carry Jan. 6 Hearings Live
articles.snippet: Its sister network, the lower-rated Fox Business, will carry live coverage, while star prime-time hosts like Tucker Carlson and Sean Hannity will proceed as usual.
articles.abstract: Its sister network, the lower-rated Fox Business, will carry live coverage, while star prime-time hosts like Tucker Carlson and Sean Hannity will proceed as usual.
articles.lead_paragraph: Follow live updates on the House committee hearing on the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol.
articles.byline: By Jeremy W. Peters and John Koblin
